thread.title: Facebook stock options point to post-earnings fireworks
thread.title_full: Facebook stock options point to post-earnings fireworks - MarketWatch

author: By     Tomi Kilgore
title: Facebook stock options point to post-earnings fireworks
text:
Getty Images Traders of Facebook Inc. stock options appear to be preparing for some extra fireworks after the social network reports quarterly results — which might be wise considering the post-earnings volatility seen in the shares of other Internet companies.
A options strategy known as a straddle, which involves the simultaneous buying of both bullish and bearish options that expire Friday, was implying a one-day, post-results move of about 8.6% in either direction on Thursday.
That’s more than double the average move of 3.4% and more than triple the median move of 2.6% on the day after the past five quarterly results from Facebook, according to FactSet data.
The last time the stock FB, +0.97% moved as much as 8.7% post results was when it soared 14% on Jan. 30, 2014, after its fourth-quarter 2013 profit and sales beat investors’ expectations. The stock was up 0.8% in midday trade Wednesday ahead second-quarter results due out after the closing bell.
Read more about what to watch for in Facebook’s earnings .
Among some of Facebook’s sector peers, Google Inc.’s stock GOOGL, +0.24% soared 16% on July 17 after the company reported results . Shares of Yelp Inc. YELP, -25.37% had plunged 28% and of Twitter Inc. TWTR, -13.93% tumbled 13% in midday trade Wednesday after the companies reported results after Tuesday’s close.
For LinkedIn Corp. LNKD, +1.02% which reports after Thursday’s close, the options market is pricing in an 11% one-day move in the stock, which seems appropriate considering it produced double-digit percentage post-earnings after the last four quarterly results.
One-day, post-results move in Twitter’s stock for last 5 quarters Quarter of reported results Date of post-results move One-day stock move (%) Q1 2015 April 23, 2015 -2.6 Q4 2014 Jan. 29, 2015 +2.3 Q3 2014 Oct. 29, 2014 -6.1 Q2 2014 July 24, 2014 +5.2 Q1 2014 April 24, 2014 -0.8 Source: FactSet More from MarketWatch
